content.body: hmm, in a spec draft i'm writing SDOs aren't being autolinked. i have e.g. `<emu-clause id="sec-struct-definitions-static-semantics-containsinstanceprivateidentifier" type="sdo">` and no linter errors

content.body: currently that's mandatory for it to figure out this is specifically an algorithm definition and not just some random clause
probably that requirement could be dropped now that everyone's adopted structured headers and we can just look for the `type` attribute instead

content.body: it was because VS Code's auto-quote insertion thing caused me to have `<dl class=""header">` instead of `<dl class="header">`

content.body: I hate when editors do auto pairing
this is the same kind of terrible as Ctrl+V being changed to paste-with-formatting
